newsitem.title: NEW ZEALAND: PRESS DIGEST - New Zealand newspapers - June 23.
newsitem.headline: PRESS DIGEST - New Zealand newspapers - June 23.

text.p: Young hero dies with brother, sister in arms: An 11-year-old boy who heroically tried to save his younger brother and sister from their burning home in Northland on Saturday night died with them in his arms. Page 1.
Budget 'won't deliver on health': The Labour Party is predicting Thursday's Budget will not deliver promised increases in health funding. Page 2.

'Win-win' aviation alliance: An international alliance between Air New Zealand, Singapore Airlines, Ansett Australia and Ansett International on Friday will give each airline strategic advantages. Page 11.
Man killed in city shooting: Second man hurt at family party: A man was killed and a male relative seriously injured in a shooting at a South Auckland family gathering on Sunday night.
Cushing paid by Peters in libel action: The Deputy Prime Minister Winston Peters has paid his $125,000 defamation bill to businessman Selwyn Cushing.

Government bulk funding allies slammed over "posh" threat: The government's allies in the fight over bulk funding of schools have been accused of planning to live up on taxpayer's money at a "posh" country retreat.
